title: affiliatery
content:
Privacy Policy

We are committed to safeguarding your privacy rights and ensuring that your personal data is protected.
This Privacy Policy explains the types of data we collect and how we process and protect that data in connection with the services we offer.
If you have additional questions or require more information about our Privacy Policy, contact us at admin@apntly.com

Data Access

We want to be transparent about how we handle your data. By using our services, you acknowledge that we may access your data to provide the requested services, troubleshoot issues, and ensure compliance with our terms of service.
Personal Data hereby means information that can directly or indirectly identify you such as your name, e-mail address, timezone, and account information. We collect personal data given to us during the onboarding process or data voluntarily given by you to us while using the platform.

Data Use

The data we collect is primarily used to deliver and enhance our services. We may use your personal information to personalize your experience, process transactions, and provide customer support.

  • We use the personal information we collect from you in order to provide the Service.
  • Additionally, we use this personal information to communicate with you, optimize or improve the App
  • Where we process your Personal Data on the basis of your consent, we will ask for your consent explicitly and only for a particular purpose.
  • This information is not shared with any third party unless explicitly stated or where required by law.

Data Maintenance

We are committed to protecting your data and maintaining its accuracy. We take reasonable measures to ensure that your information is secure and up to date. We implement industry-standard security measures to protect your personal information from unauthorized access, alteration, disclosure, or destruction. We regularly review and enhance our security practices to ensure the ongoing integrity of our systems.

Data Sharing

We respect your privacy and do not sell or rent your personal information to third parties unless required by law.

Data Access Consent Rights:

We are committed to upholding your data subject access rights and ensuring transparency in the processing of your personal information. As a data subject, you have the following rights:

  • Right to Access: You have the right to request access to the personal information we hold about you. Upon receiving such a request, we will provide you with a copy of the relevant data, along with details about how and why your personal information is being processed.
  • Right to Rectification: If you believe that the personal information we hold about you is inaccurate or incomplete, you have the right to request its rectification. We will promptly update any inaccurate or outdated information to ensure its accuracy.
  • Right to Erasure: You have the right to request the erasure of your personal information under certain circumstances. This right is also known as the "right to be forgotten." Upon receiving such a request, we will promptly delete your personal information.
  • Right to Withdraw Consent: You have the right to withdraw that consent at any time.

To exercise any of the rights mentioned above, please contact us using the contact information provided at the end of this privacy policy.

How long do we process the collected Data?

We will retain your information for as long as your account is active or as needed to provide you services.

Cookies

Some of our Site pages utilize "cookies" and other tracking technologies.
Cookies are small files placed on your hard drive that can help us analyze our web page flow; customize our services.
These cookies are used to store information including visitors' preferences, and the pages on the website that the visitor accessed or visited

Children’s Online Privacy Protection

The Services are not designed for or directed to children under the age of 1.
Appointly does not knowingly collect Personal Information from children under the age of 16. By providing information to Appointly, you represent that you are 16 years of age or older. If you think that your child provided this kind of information on our website, contact us immediately and we will remove such information from our records.

Changes to this Privacy Policy

We may occasionally update this Privacy Policy to reflect company and customer feedback. It is our policy to post any changes we make to this Privacy Policy on this page.
We encourages you to periodically review this Privacy Policy to be informed of how we protecting your information.

If you have additional questions or require more information about our Privacy Policy, contact us at admin@apntly.com

  This Privacy Policy explains the types of data we collect and how we process and protect that data in

  To exercise any of the rights mentioned above, please contact us using the contact information provided at the end
